availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Johnson County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Son of John Vanhoose. Married to Jemima Vanhoose. Father of John Vanhoose, Mary Vanhoose, Julina Vanhoose, and Vashti Vanhoose. Resident of Floyd County, Kentucky, in 1830. Farmer in Johnson County in 1850. Farmer in Johnson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Fifth Manuscript Census of the United States (1830), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Floyd County, p. 100.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 111B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 224.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, Toms Creek, p. 200A.
